definition: to block one's ears and not listen (idiom); to turn a deaf ear
to fill/to satisfy/to fulfill/to act in place of/substitute/sufficient/full
ear/handle (archaeology)/and that is all (Classical Chinese)
(negative prefix)/not/no
to hear/news/well-known/famous/reputation/fame/to smell/to sniff at
surname Wen

sentences.english: They too have been deaf to the voice of justice and of consanguinity.
sentences.chinese: 可他们对这种正义和同宗的呼声也同样充耳不闻。

sentences.english: If you turn a deaf ear to my warnings, you'll land in trouble.
sentences.chinese: 如果你对我的告诫充耳不闻，你就会惹麻烦的。

sentences.english: I didn't expect him to turn a deaf ear to his comrades' criticism.
sentences.chinese: 我没料想到他对同志们的批评竟充耳不闻。

sentences.english: If an owl speak to thee, make it no answer.
sentences.chinese: 若有只猫头鹰跟你搭话，只充耳不闻。

sentences.english: Hank's dog turns on strangers but he turns a deaf ear to that.
sentences.chinese: 汉克家的狗袭击陌生人，但是他对这事充耳不闻。

sentences.english: Nobody likes to not be heard.
sentences.chinese: 没有人喜欢别人对自己的话充耳不闻。
门铃叮当响，我却充耳不闻。

sentences.english: Don't be deaf to hear it from the person who says it with their heart.
sentences.chinese: 只要所言出自爱心，就不可以充耳不闻。

sentences.english: She turned a deaf ear to our warnings and got lost.
sentences.chinese: 她对我们的警告充耳不闻，结果迷了路。

sentences.english: The provincial assembly were deaf to all pleas for financial help.
sentences.chinese: 省议会对所有的经济救助请求都充耳不闻。

sentences.english: BP's leadership seemed tone-deaf and slow.
sentences.chinese: 而BP的领导层似乎对此充耳不闻，行动迟缓。

sentences.english: Even so, Canada’s foreign ministry seems to have a tin ear for the organisation’s politics.
sentences.chinese: 即使如此，加政府外交部似乎对政治充耳不闻。

sentences.english: The lecturer tried to drum in his viewpoint, but the students were not listening.
sentences.chinese: 演讲者设法讲明他的观点，但学生们却充耳不闻。

sentences.english: He turns a deaf ear to the criticism from the media.
sentences.chinese: 他对来自于媒体的批评充耳不闻。

sentences.english: They were deaf to the victim's appeal.
sentences.chinese: 他们对受害者的诉求充耳不闻。

sentences.english: But their words fell on deaf ears.
sentences.chinese: 但政府对他们的担忧充耳不闻。

definition: to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
to hear but not react (idiom); to turn a deaf ear/to ignore deliberately
to turn a blind eye to
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
aloof/indifferent/unconcerned
to remain unmoved
to pay no heed to (idiom)/to ignore/to brush aside
to completely ignore (idiom)/to pay no attention to/not to be in the least concerned about
not to hear, not to question (idiom)/to show no interest in sth/uncritical/not in the least concerned
not the least bit concerned/completely indifferent
to disdain as beneath contempt (idiom)
to pay no attention to a familiar sight/to ignore
to play deaf-mute
totally unaware
to heed/to pay attention to
the cool eye of a bystander/a detached point of view
